rpCntInfo.cntHours: 8;30 am to 5 pm MST, Monday to Friday

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: Data set was created under the authority of the Chief Electoral Officer of the NWT. Permission to use the data must be obtained from the Office of the Chief Electoral Officer.

identAuth.resTitle: Legislative and Executive Council Act of the NWT, Schedule A

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This is a compilation of the boundaries of the 19 NWT Electoral Districts based upon the legal descriptions found in Schedule A of Legislative Assembly and Executive Council Act plus any Polling Divisions within each Electoral District. There is an Electoral Boundary Commission scheduled to occur prior to the next Territorial Election on Ocotber 5th, 2015. As a result of this Commission, there may be changes to Electoral District boundaries. This is the Electoral Districts dataset.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Part of the Elections NWT mandate is to provide maps to all the Deputy Returning Officers and for candidate use during the periodic NWT Elections. To create these maps requires accurate boundaries of each of the 19 Electoral Districts of the NWTt. Previous versions of the required maps had been created by Earth Tec of Edmonton in Autocad format. These maps were not very detailed and within communities did not include the complete extent of the Electoral District

Using Schedule A from the Legislative Assembly and Executive Council Act of the GNWT, the legal descriptions were used to create each Electoral District. The existing legal descriptions were reviewed and issues are detailed in the supplemental information. The Chief Electoral Officer did not believe that these would affect any potential voters so they will be addressed as part of the Electoral Boundary Commission.

At the very end of the project, the decision was made to also include digital polling division boundaries. These boundaries were based on a document: 2011 Polling Divisions_Descriptions and Keys_24 June 2011.docx provided by Elections NWT. The polling division descriptions were created by each Electoral District and were not consistent or clear. The Chief Electoral Officer had to make interpretations on some boundary locations. This dataset only includes boundaries but no attributes.

It was noted that Yellowknife, Hay River and Inuvik had street addresses as part of their community maps. Parcel and street number data as shapefiles was acquired from theCity of Yellowknife, Lot/parcel/block and street annotation was acquired from AECOM via the Town of Inuvik. The Earth Tech data was the best available for Hay River as it does not appear as though the Town of Hay River has any digital property related data.Hard copy version of the Hay River street addresses were compared to the Earth Tech data and there were not significant changes to the street names to update them. At the end of the project, an attempt was made to correct some street names where problems were known.

Statistics NWT does have street addressing for all NWT Communities that do have street addresses. The data was reviewed, however attributes were not compatible with MACA attribute data.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Cathie Harper, NWTCG - data creation David Brock, Chief Electoral Officer, Elections NWT.

Consts.useLimit: Data set was created under the authority of the Chief Electoral Officer of the NWT. Permission to use the data must be obtained from the Office of the Chief Electoral Officer.

rpCntInfo.cntHours: 8:30 am to 5 pm MST Monday to Friday
8:30 am - 5 pm MST, Monday to Friday

dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
The legal descriptions were reviewed as part of the boundary creation and ‘problem’ areas were identified with recommended solutions.
• some places where there appear to be typos • within some of the Yellowknife Electoral Districts there have been some changes in Lot, Block and Plan designations as a result of new surveys being completed and the original Lot references are no longer valid • In some spots, the description could be simplified without affecting the intent of the boundaries
There were some additional specific concerns: • The northern limits of Nunakput do not follow any accepted NWT boundary. • Hay River South appears to use the Enterprise Community Boundary northern extent as its southern boundary • Only YK Centre of the Yellowknife EDs does not include part of the Yellowknife Municipal Boundary as part of it • Fort Smith is on the 60th parallel and portions of it according to survey monuments are actually in Alberta • Kam Lake ED, the NW boundary with YK South was based on a parcel that has now been resurveyed and the legal description would have it cross several parcels that were created as part of this split. It was noted that there are no residences that are affected at this time so the adjustment will be made after the Election.
The Chief Electoral Officer, David Brock stated that he did not think that the problem areas would affect any voters so these will be addressed after the election.
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.0.3035

Consts.useLimit: Data set was created under the authority of the Chief Electoral Officer of the NWT. Permission to use the data must be obtained from the Office of the Chief Electoral Officer.

dataLineage.statement:
Using Schedule A from the Legislative Assembly and Executive Council Act of the GNWT, the legal descriptions were used to create each Electoral District.
For the actual creation of each ED, existing digital data was used and included the following: • MACA data for lot, block and plan data for parcels, hydrology data within urban areas. These were saved on an ED basis • National Road Network data for centre lines of roads within urban areas. These were saved on an ED basis • Inuvialuit western and northern boundaries will be used to close off the outer limits of Nunakput • NWT boundary created by the GNWT NWTCG for most of NWT boundary • NRCan CGB1 provincial polygon data for Nunavut boundary to southern limits of Nunakput and Yukon boundary to reduce edits • Mackenzie Delta and Tu Nedhe shapefiles from previous projects.
Digital data that had to be created: • ED straight line segments using Excel, text files and GENERATE • 20 mile buffer of the Beaufort Sea for Nunakput boundary using 1:250,000 NTDB data and the BUFFER command.
Once all data created, it was compiled using APPEND with NOTEST. To close all polygons within the shapefile using ArcMap was not possible so used ARC/INFO Workstation.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Data collected in Lat/long. DIstances not relevant

attr.attrdefs: Schedule A of Legislative Assembly and Executive Council Act

attrdomv.udom: attribute can be either YK for Yellowknife Electoral Districts, HR for Hay River Electoral Districts, IN for Inuvik Electoral Districts or N for all other Electoral Districts

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
